H0.text: By what more familiar name do we know the 'Angevin Dynasty' of English kings. Lancaster

H1.text: By what more familiar name do we know the 'Angevin Dynasty' of English kings. Tudor

H2.text: By what more familiar name do we know the 'Angevin Dynasty' of English kings. York

H3.text: By what more familiar name do we know the 'Angevin Dynasty' of English kings. PlantagenÃªt

A4.text: the retrospective usage of the name for all of Geoffrey's male-line descendants was popular during the subsequent Tudor dynasty, perhaps encouraged by the further legitimacy it gave to Richard's great-grandson, Henry VIII.

A5.text: The House of Plantagenet was a royal house which originated in the French county of Anjou.

A6.text: The Plantagenet kings were often forced to negotiate compromises such as Magna Carta, which constrained royal power in return for financial and military support.

A7.text: the rivalry between the House of Plantagenet's two cadet branches of York and Lancaster brought about the Wars of the Roses
